Class Dimension

java.lang.Object
  Dimension

public class Dimension
extends Object

A vector in 2D.

Holds two coordinates declared as double. It makes easier to call, or return from functions, which use geometric coordinaes. Shortens the work in the PHY project. One does not have to bother with coordinates of x and y, just use a Dimension object like this and both x and y will be included.

Constructor Summary
Dimension()
          Creates a Dimension with coordinates in the origin.
Dimension(Dimension d)
          Creates a new Dimension object by referring to an already declared Dimension.
Dimension(double x, double y)
          Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.
Dimension(float x, float y)
          Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.
Dimension(int x, int y)
          Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.

          Modifies the Dimension object, by assigning it new coordinates passed as arguments.

Constructor Detail

Dimension

Dimension()
Creates a Dimension with coordinates in the origin.

Dimension

Dimension(Dimension d)
Creates a new Dimension object by referring to an already declared Dimension. Actually it creates a copy of the parameter.

Parameters:
d - the Dimension object to be copied

Dimension

Dimension(double x,
          double y)
Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.

Parameters:
x - double representing the position on x axis.
y - double representing the position on y axis.

Dimension

Dimension(float x,
          float y)
Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.

Parameters:
x - float, later converted to double representing the position on x axis.
y - float, later converted to doulbe representing the position on y axis.

Dimension

Dimension(int x,
          int y)
Creates a Dimension with coordinates x and y.

Parameters:
x - integer, later converted to double representing the position on x axis.
y - integer, later converted to doulbe representing the position on y axis.
